body.p: Long-stemmed roses are a classic and romantic gift, especially popular for occasions like Valentineâ€™s Day or other special events. These roses are known for their elegant appearance and long history.
Hybrid Tea Rose: The rose used for most long-stemmed arrangements is the hybrid tea rose, which was first bred about 115 years ago.
Color Choices: Long-stemmed roses are available in a variety of colors, including red, white, pink, orange, yellow, and purple.

Stem Length: Roses are sold by stem length, measured in centimeters. The longer the stem, the larger the bud. Common lengths include 60 cm (long-stemmed), 40 cm (short-stemmed), and 15 cm (naturally blossoming).
Reviving a Wilted Rose: To revive a wilted rose, trim an inch off the stem and submerge the entire flower underwater in a sink or bathtub for 20 minutes to an hour.
Pruning: Pruning removes other buds and side branches from the stem, helping the plant stay healthy and produce larger flowers.
